Name: Falcon amulet
Description: A falcon with the double crown, depicting the god Horus. This kind of amulet was not strictly funerary and is known from prehistoric times down to the Ptolemaic Period. This piece is made of blue-green faience. The bird, with the face, claws and feathers worked out in detail, is squatting on a base. The wings lie along the body. Between the head and the crown is a loop for suspension.
